questions.question: Sam ......................... James has agreed to come.
questions.description: When we connect two singular subjects with as well as, the verb is singular in number.

questions.question: ……………………… being rich and famous, she is very humble.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition. It should be followed by a noun or ing form.

questions.question: We played to the best of our ability …………………….., we could not win.
questions.description: However does not connect two sentences. It is a transitional adverb. Put a full stop or a semicolon before however.

questions.question: You should not marry ……………………….. you are financially independent.
questions.description: Either could be used here with slightly different meanings.

questions.question: You must work ……………………. starve.
questions.description: Or is used to give the alternative.

questions.question: She ought to get the job ……………………….. she is the most suitable candidate.
questions.description: For is possible here is a more formal style.

questions.question: ……………………… he is not educated, he is industrious.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: ……………………….. it was a hot day, I felt lethargic.
………………………. you are free tomorrow, let’s catch up over a coffee.
I wasn’t feeling well, …………………….. I called in sick.
This is the park ………………………. we used to meet.
